Plant development work is solid background
for a future in chemical engineering
The work of production supervisors
at Du Pont, as discussed here last
month, is aimed at getting better
results from existing processes and
equipment.
In contrast, the job of plant development groups is to find ways to
improve methods and products, and
advise management when changes
should be made for economic or technical reasons. Chemical engineers in
this work are responsible for lowering process costs, adapting the product to new uses and improving product quality to obtain a larger share
of the existing market.

Carpenter, through the S.A.C.,
has exerted a steadying influence
throughout the relatively autonomous student organizations at
Hopkins. The S.A.C. is supposedly
responsible for the satisfactory
functioning af most non•athletic
activities on campus. In effect,
however, this has meant merely
a financial supervision—the distribution of a fixed budget among
the various activities.
Carpenter has always taken an
active role in student life at Hopkins. He was elected to the Student Council in his freshman and
sophomore years and has returned to school early each September
to work on freshman orientation
programs. Yet Carpenter, has
never actively campaigned for any
office. This fact has frequently
been attributed .t.o his mustache;
for, as an unidentified student
once phrased it, "They thnk he's
a professor." The highlight of his
athletic career came early in his
college days when he failed fresh-

man gym.
Carpenter's energetic participation in a number of activities has
won him recognition in 0.D.K.,
Who's Who in American Colleges,
and A meric,an Student Leaders.
Because of his level headed judgment he is greatly respected by
all campus leaders.
An outstanding feature of Carpenter's personality is the easy
and natural way he has fitted in
with the younger college-age. men.

The work of production supervisors
at Du Pont, as discussed here last
month, is aimed at getting better
results from existing processes and
equipment.
In contrast, the job of plant development groups is to find ways to
improve methods and products, and
advise management when changes
should be made for economic or technical reasons. Chemical engineers in
this work are responsible for lowering process costs, adapting the product to new uses and improving product quality to obtain a larger share
of the existing market.
